tracking.title: Tracking

insights.title: Insights & Analytics
insights.subtitle: Your physiological progress and breathing patterns

settings.title: Profile
settings.subtitle: Manage your account and preferences
settings.session_desc: Log out of your current session
settings.privacy_right_access: Access - You can view all your data in the app
settings.privacy_right_rectify: Rectification - You can modify your data in the app
settings.privacy_right_delete: Deletion - You can delete your account (see below)
settings.privacy_right_transfer: Portability - You can export your data as JSON
settings.export_desc: Download all your data in JSON format. This includes all measurements, sessions and log entries.
settings.delete_desc: This permanently deletes your account and all associated data. This action cannot be undone.

cp.instructions_title: How to measure your Control Pause?
cp.instruction_2: Breathe normally in and out through your nose
cp.instruction_3: After a normal exhale, pinch your nose shut
cp.instruction_5: Stop when you feel the first urge to breathe
cp.instruction_6: This is your Control Pause (not maximum breath hold!)
cp.empty_desc: Start measuring to track your progress
cp.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this CP measurement?
cp.insights_good: üëç Good progress! Average CP of {n}s is a healthy level.
cp.log_description: Log your Control Pause measurement here after measuring it outside the app, or go to Exercises for the guided Buteyko timer.
cp.guided_hint: Want to use the guided Buteyko timer?
cp.alert_range: CP value must be between 1 and 300 seconds

hrv.title: HRV Measurement
hrv.description: Heart Rate Variability (HRV) measures the variation between heartbeats. A higher HRV indicates a better functioning autonomic nervous system and greater stress resilience.
hrv.instruction_1: Measure HRV with a smartwatch, heart rate monitor or app
hrv.instruction_2: Preferably measure in the morning after waking up
hrv.invalid_value: Please enter a valid HRV number
hrv.value_range: HRV value must be between 10 and 200
hrv.heartrate_range: Heart rate must be between 30 and 220 bpm
hrv.empty_desc: Add your first HRV measurement via the Tracking tab
hrv.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this HRV measurement?
hrv.auto_baseline_update: Updated weekly based on your measurements
hrv.auto_baseline_desc: Your automatic baseline is {n}ms (30-day median) - updated weekly
hrv.goal_hint_desc: Use this if you want to track a specific HRV goal
hrv.about_1: Higher HRV = better recovery and less stress
hrv.about_2: Measure in the morning right after waking up
hrv.scroll_hint: Swipe horizontally to see all measurements

journal_form.empty_desc: Start your first entry to track your progress
journal_form.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this?

sessions.empty_desc: Start Resonant Breathing to track your sessions
sessions.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this breathing session?
sessions.insights_goal_reached: Great! You've reached the 50-minute per week goal
sessions.insights_total_time: You have practiced {n} minutes in total
sessions.insights_perfect: ‚úÖ Perfect! Sessions of 10+ minutes are ideal for HRV training

resonant.mood_before_label: How did you feel before the session? (optional)
resonant.duration_hint: The exercise stops automatically after {n} minutes.
resonant.duration_optimal: Choose 10-20 minutes for optimal HRV training.
resonant.science_text: This synchronizes your breathing with your heart rate variability.
resonant.extended_hold_desc: In (3s) ‚Üí Out (3s) ‚Üí Pause after exhale. This extended breath pause increases your CO2 tolerance and reduces hyperventilation according to the Buteyko method.
resonant.tip_coherent_1: Breathe slowly and deeply through your nose
resonant.tip_coherent_2: Use your belly (diaphragm) - feel your belly expand on inhalation
resonant.tip_coherent_3: Stay relaxed, don't force anything - comfort is more important than perfection
resonant.tip_coherent_4: 10-20 minutes daily significantly increases your HRV
resonant.tip_coherent_5: Best times: in the morning, before sleep, or during stress
resonant.tip_buteyko_1: Breathe LIGHTLY and quietly through your nose - less volume than normal
resonant.tip_buteyko_2: The pause after exhalation should be comfortable - no struggle
resonant.tip_buteyko_3: You may feel a slight 'air hunger' - this is normal and healthy
resonant.tip_buteyko_4: Start short and build gradually - overtraining can cause hyperventilation
resonant.tip_buteyko_5: Measure your Control Pause (CP) regularly to track progress
resonant.notes_placeholder: e.g. Felt relaxed, slight dizziness at the start...

intensity.empty_desc: Start adding symptom entries to track your intensity trends
intensity.no_scores_desc: Your log entries don't contain intensity scores
intensity.trend_positive: ‚úÖ Positive trend! Your average intensity is decreasing.
intensity.trend_negative: ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: Your intensity is increasing. Consider more exercises or professional support.
intensity.trend_stable: üëç Your average intensity is well under control.

journal_analysis.title: Journal Analysis
journal_analysis.subtitle: Patterns and insights based on your log entries
journal_analysis.empty_desc: Add entries via the Tracking tab to discover patterns.
journal_analysis.technique_effect_desc: Average intensity before use (lower = more effective)
journal_analysis.no_technique_data: Add intensity scores to your entries to see this overview
journal_analysis.no_severity_data: Add intensity scores to your entries to see this overview
journal_analysis.no_trend_data: Not enough data for a trend
journal_analysis.insight_worst_trigger: ‚ö†Ô∏è {trigger} is associated with the highest average intensity ({avg}/10).
journal_analysis.insight_trend_up: üìà Your intensity has risen recently ‚Äî consider more exercises.
journal_analysis.insight_trend_down: üìâ Great progress! Your intensity is declining over the recent period.
journal_analysis.insight_trend_stable: üìä Your intensity has been stable over the recent period.
journal_analysis.trigger_severity_desc: Average intensity when this trigger was present
journal_analysis.sensation_severity_desc: Average intensity when this sensation was present
